Class Pokemon

java.lang.Object
Card
Pokemon
Direct Known Subclasses:
Charmander, Eevee, Lapras, Pikachu, Skarmory
public class Pokemon extends Card
The Pokemon class holds information about a Pokemon including core stats about them.
Author:
Rachel Hussmann

    • Pokemon

      public Pokemon()
      Default constructor

  • Method Details

    • getHp

      public int getHp()
      The getHp method returns the value of the health points of the Pokemon.
      Returns:
      The total health points of the Pokemon.

    • setHp

      public void setHp(int hp)
      The setHp method accepts a new value for the Pokemon's HP and sets it.
      Parameters:
      hp - The new value for hp.

    • getAttacks

      public ArrayList<Attack> getAttacks()
      The getAttacks method return an ArrayList of Attack objects of the pokemon.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Attack objects.

    • setAttacks

      public void setAttacks(ArrayList<Attack> attacks)
      The setAttacks method accepts an ArrayList of Attack objects to assign to the pokemon.
      Parameters:
      attacks - An ArrayList of attack objects to set for the pokemon.

    • getWeakness

      public String getWeakness()
      The getWeakness method returns the type the pokemon is weak against.
      Returns:
      The string of the type the pokemon is weak against.

    • setWeakness

      public void setWeakness(String weakness)
      The setWeakness method accepts a new type that the pokemon is weak against
      Parameters:
      weakness - A string of the type the pokemon is weak against.

    • getType

      public String getType()
      The getType method returns the type of the pokemon.
      Returns:
      The type of the pokemon in a string.

    • setType

      public void setType(String type)
      The setType method accepts a string of the new type for the pokemon.
      Parameters:
      type - A string of the new type for the pokemon.

    • getRetreatCost

      public int getRetreatCost()
      The getRetreatCost returns the amount of energies required to let the pokemon retreat to the bench.
      Returns:
      The number energies required to let the pokemon retreat.

    • setRetreatCost

      public void setRetreatCost(int retreatCost)
      The setRetreatCost accepts the new number of energies required to let the pokemon retreat to the bench.
      Parameters:
      retreatCost - The new number of energies required to let the pokemon retreat.

    • addOneRetreatCost

      public void addOneRetreatCost()
      The addOneRetreatCost method adds one to the retreatCost variable. Used after the player uses an X Speed trainer card to make the retreatCost return to normal.

    • subtractOneRetreatCost

      public void subtractOneRetreatCost()
      The subtractOneRetreatCost method subtracts one from the retreatCost variable. Used once the player uses an X Speed trainer card.

    • getEnergiesAttached

      public ArrayList<Energy> getEnergiesAttached()
      Getter for the energiesAttached variable
      Returns:
      The ArrayList of energies attached to the pokemon

    • setEnergiesAttached

      public void setEnergiesAttached(ArrayList<Energy> energiesAttached)
      Setter for the energiesAttached variable
      Parameters:
      energiesAttached - The new ArrayList of energies attached to the pokemon

    • checkIfAttackIsValid

      public boolean checkIfAttackIsValid(Attack attack)
      The checkIfAttackIsValid method checks to see if the player can use that attack by checking the number of energies required for the attack.
      Parameters:
      attack - The Attack that the player would like the pokemon to use.
      Returns:
      true - if the attack is valid and the pokemon has the correct energies and number of energies to initiate the attack false - if the attack is not valid and the pokemon either does not have enough energies or the right type of energies to attack

    • battle

      public void battle(Attack pokemonAttack, Pokemon defendingPokemon)
      The battle method manages a battle between two pokemon.
      Parameters:
      pokemonAttack - The Attack the attacking pokemon will use.
      defendingPokemon - The defending pokemon that will be losing HP.

    • attachEnergy

      public void attachEnergy(Energy cardToAttach)
      The attachEnergy method accepts an energy card the that player would like to attach to a pokemon.
      Parameters:
      cardToAttach - The energy to attach to the pokemon.

    • checkForRetreat

      public boolean checkForRetreat()
      The checkForRetreat method checks to see if this Pokemon object can retreat from active status.
      Returns:
      true - If the Pokemon has enough energies to retreat, false - If the Pokemon does not have enough energies to retreat
